...Sun Microsystems Inc. stock also faltered, down 9.9 per cent to $2.70 after an analyst downgrade. ...
Sun Microsystems Inc. 주식 역시 분석가들의 (Sun 주식에 대한) 등급격하를 계기로 9.9%가 내려가 $2.70으로 헤메고 (혹은 힘을 잃어 비틀거리고) 있음.
요즘 어느 신문기사를 들쳐도 주식시장에 관한 한 긍정적인 소식은 찾아 볼 수 없습니다. 언제까지 plows below, falter 등등 비관적인 단어가 신문기사를 메울지 원~
야후사전... fal·ter － v.i.
1 비틀거리다, 비쓱거리다(stumble). 2 더듬더듬[띄엄띄엄] 말하다, 말을 더듬다; <말·목소리가> 막히다. ㆍ His tongue[He] ∼s. 그는 말을 더듬거린다. 3 주저하다, 망설이다, 머뭇거리다(hesitate); <용기·결심 등이> 흔들리다, 꺾이다. 4 세력[영향력]이 없어지다. －v.t. …을 더듬더듬[더듬거리며] 말하다; …을 머뭇머뭇 말하다<out>. ㆍ ∼ (out) an apology 더듬거리며 사과하다.
－n. 1 비틀거리기, 머뭇거리기; 기죽음. 2 (말을) 더듬거리기. ▷ ∼·er n., ∼·ing·ly adv.
(from Cambridge International Dictionary of English) falter verb [I] to lose strength or purpose and (almost) stop The dinner party conversation faltered for a moment. Her friends never faltered in their belief in her. Nigel's voice faltered and he stopped speaking.
To falter is also to move uncertainly as if you might fall. The nurse saw him falter and made him lean on her.
faltering adjective This legislation is aimed at stimulating the faltering economy. The child's faltering words were sometimes hard to understand.
falteringly adverb
m-w dictionary... 1 a : to walk unsteadily : STUMBLE b : to give way : TOTTER <could feel my legs faltering> c : to move waveringly or hesitatingly 2 : to speak brokenly or weakly : STAMMER 3 a : to hesitate in purpose or action : WAVER b : to lose drive or effectiveness <the business was faltering> transitive senses : to utter hesitatingly or brokenly synonym see HESITATE
FALTER implies a wavering or stumbling and often connotes nervousness, lack of courage, or outright fear <never once faltered during her testimony>.
